intro: Rhabdotosperma brevipedicellata, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, spiny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by small, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
